instruction: Robin's hair was 19 inches long. If he grew 18 more inches. How long is his hair now?
output: Robin's hair was 19 inches long. He grew 18 more inches, so now his hair is 19 + 18 = 37 inches long. The answer is 37.

instruction: Next on his checklist is wax to stick the feathers together. He needs 159 g of wax more. If the feathers require a total of 628 g of wax. How many grams of wax does he already have?
output: He needs 159 g of wax more. That means he already has 628 - 159 = 469 g of wax. The answer is 469.

instruction: Baker sold 8 cakes. If he had made 40 cakes initially. How many more cakes did baker make than those he sold?
output: Baker made 40 cakes initially. He sold 8 cakes. That means he still has 40 - 8 = 32 cakes. The answer is 32.

instruction: Bryan took a look at his books as well. If he has 34 books distributed equally in 2 bookshelves. How many books are there in each bookshelf?
output: Bryan has 34 books distributed equally in 2 bookshelves. This means each bookshelf has 34 / 2 = 17 books. The answer is 17.

instruction: At the zoo, a cage had 93 snakes and 97 alligators. If 40 alligators were hiding. How many alligators were not hiding?
output: There were 97 alligators in the cage. 40 of them were hiding. That means there were 97 - 40 = 57 alligators that were not hiding. The answer is 57.

instruction: Bryan took a look at his books and magazines. If he has 9 books and 46 magazines in each of his 10 bookshelves. How many magazines does he have in total?
output: He has 10 bookshelves. Each bookshelf has 9 books and 46 magazines. That means in total he has 10 * (9 + 46) = 510 magazines. The answer is 510.

instruction: They decided to hold the party in their backyard. They have some sets of tables, each having the 3 chairs. If there are a total of 9 chairs in the backyard. How many sets of tables do they have?
output: Each set of tables has 3 chairs. That means there are 3 chairs per set. There are 9 chairs in total. So, the number of sets must be 9 / 3 = 3. The answer is 3.

instruction: Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 6 cups of flour and 13 cups of sugar. She already put in some cups of flour. If she still needs 8 more cups of flour than sugar. How many more cups of flour does she need to add?
output: The recipe calls for 6 cups of flour and 13 cups of sugar. She already put in some cups of flour. So she still needs 6 - some = 8 more cups of flour than sugar. The answer is 8.

instruction: There are 203 bananas and 63 oranges in Philip's collection. If the bananas are organized into 7 groups and oranges are organized into 95 groups. How big is each group of bananas?
output: There are 203 bananas and 63 oranges. We need to divide the bananas into 7 groups and the oranges into 95 groups. The number of bananas in each group must be 203 / 7 = 29. The answer is 29.

instruction: White t - shirts can be purchased in packages of 53. If mom buys 57 packages of white t - shirts and 34 trousers. How many white t - shirts will she have?
output: Mom bought 57 packages of white t - shirts. Each package contains 53 t - shirts. So in total she has 57 * 53 = 3021 t - shirts. She also bought 34 trousers. The answer is 3021.

instruction: Baker made 7 cakes and 148 pastries. If he sold 15 cakes and 103 pastries. How many pastries would baker still have?
output: Baker made 7 cakes and 148 pastries. He sold 15 cakes and 103 pastries. That means he still has 7 - 15 = -8 cakes and 148 - 103 = 45 pastries. The answer is 45.

instruction: Rebecca wants to split a collection of eggs into groups of 11. If each group has 2 eggs. How many eggs does Rebecca have?
output: Rebecca wants to split the eggs into groups of 11. Each group has 2 eggs. That means she needs 11 * 2 = 22 eggs. The answer is 22.

instruction: At the zoo, a cage had snakes and alligators. The total number of animals in the cage was 79. If 24 snakes and 51 alligators were hiding. How many animals were not hiding in all?
output: There were 79 animals in the cage. 24 snakes and 51 alligators were hiding. That means 79 - 24 - 51 = 4 animals were not hiding. The answer is 4.

instruction: A mailman has to give 4 pieces of junk mail to each house in each of the 81 blocks. If there are 12 houses in each block. How many pieces of junk mail should he give in each block?
output: There are 12 houses in each block. The mailman has to give 4 pieces of junk mail to each house. That means he has to give 12 * 4 = 48 pieces of junk mail in each block. The answer is 48.

instruction: There are 8 different books and 5 different movies in the ' crazy silly school ' series. If you read 19 of the movies and watched 16 of the books. How many more movies than books have you read?
output: There are 8 books and 5 movies in the series. You read 19 movies and watched 16 books. That means you read 19 - 16 = 3 more movies than books. The answer is 3.

instruction: After resting they decided to go for a swim. If the depth of the water is 10 times Dean's height and he stands at 9 feet. How much deeper is the water than Dean's height?
output: Dean stands at 9 feet. The water is 10 times his height. That means the water is 10 * 9 = 90 feet deep. The difference between Dean's height and the water's depth is 90 - 9 = 81 feet. The answer is 81 feet.

instruction: Carol was sending out birthday invitations to her friends. Each package of invitations she bought had 3 invitations in it and she bought 2 packs. If she wants to invite 9 friends. How many extra invitations will she need to buy?
output: She bought 2 packs of invitations, each with 3 invitations. That means she has 2 * 3 = 6 invitations. She wants to invite 9 friends, so she needs 9 - 6 = 3 extra invitations. The answer is 3.

instruction: Olivia spent 38 dollars at a supermarket. If there were 128 dollars in her wallet initially. How much money does she have left?
output: Olivia had 128 dollars in her wallet initially. She spent 38 dollars at the supermarket. So now she has 128 - 38 = 90 dollars. The answer is 90.

instruction: Debby bought 360 soda bottles and 162 water bottles when they were on sale. If she drank 122 water bottles and 9 soda bottles a day. How many days would the soda bottles last?
output: Debby bought 360 soda bottles and 162 water bottles. She drank 122 water bottles and 9 soda bottles a day. That means she drank a total of 122 + 9 = 131 bottles a day. The total number of bottles she bought was 360 + 162 = 522. So, the number of days the soda bottles will last is 522 / 131 = 4 days. The answer is 4 days.

instruction: At the arcade Dave had won 18 tickets. If he used 5 to buy some toys and 11 more to buy some clothes. How many tickets did Dave have left?
output: Dave had 18 tickets. He used 5 to buy toys, so now he has 18 - 5 = 13 tickets. He used 11 more to buy clothes, so now he has 13 - 11 = 2 tickets. The answer is 2.

instruction: Bobby had 22 pieces of candy. He ate some pieces of candy. Then he ate 5 more. If he still has 8 pieces of candy left. How many pieces of candy had he eaten at the start?
output: Bobby had 22 pieces of candy. He ate some pieces of candy, and then he ate 5 more. He still has 8 pieces of candy left. This means he must have eaten 22 - 8 = 14 pieces of candy. The answer is 14.

instruction: After a typhoon, 13 trees in Haley's backyard died. If she had grown 3 trees initially. How many more trees died in the typhoon than those that survived?
output: Haley had 3 trees initially. After the typhoon, 13 trees died. That means 13 - 3 = 10 trees died in the typhoon. The answer is 10.

instruction: If you had 33 cookies and each bag has 11 cookies. How many bags of cookies do you have?
output: We have 33 cookies. Each bag has 11 cookies. We can divide 33 by 11 to find out how many bags we have. 33 / 11 = 3. So we have 3 bags. The answer is 3.

instruction: They decided to hold the party in their backyard. If they have 11 sets of tables and each set has 13 chairs. How many chairs do they have in the backyard?
output: They have 11 sets of tables. Each set has 13 chairs. That means in total they have 11 * 13 = 143 chairs. The answer is 143.

instruction: If each pack costs 81 dollars. How much will it cost to buy 33 packs of dvds?
output: Each pack costs 81 dollars. To buy 33 packs, it will cost 33 * 81 = 2673 dollars. The answer is 2673.

instruction: In Haley's class 4 are boys who love to play marbles. If Haley has 23 marbles and wants to keep 15 marbles for herself. How many will each of the boys receive?
output: Haley has 23 marbles and wants to keep 15 for herself. That means she has 23 - 15 = 8 marbles to share. There are 4 boys, so each of them will receive 8 / 4 = 2 marbles. The answer is 2.

instruction: There are 62 different movies and 19 different books in the ' crazy silly school ' series. If you read 4 of the books and watched 34 of the movies. How many more books do you still have to read?
output: There are 62 movies and 19 books in the series. You have read 4 books and watched 34 movies. That means you still have 19 - 4 = 15 books left to read. The answer is 15.

instruction: The bananas in Philip's collection are organized into groups of size 18. If there are a total of 180 bananas in Philip's banana collection. How many groups are there?
output: There are 180 bananas in total. Each group has 18 bananas. That means there must be 180 / 18 = 10 groups. The answer is 10.

instruction: After resting they decided to go for a swim. The depth of the water is 2 times Dean's height. Dean is 8 feet shorter than Ron. If Ron stands at 14 feet. How deep was the water?
output: Ron stands at 14 feet. Dean is 8 feet shorter than Ron, so Dean stands at 14 - 8 = 6 feet. The depth of the water is 2 times Dean's height, so the depth of the water is 2 * 6 = 12 feet. The answer is 12 feet.

instruction: Because of the decision Sofia asked the students to suggest specific types of food. If 144 students suggested adding mashed potatoes 467 suggested adding bacon to the menu and 79 suggested adding tomatoes. How many more students suggested mashed potatoes than those that suggested tomatoes?
output: 144 students suggested mashed potatoes, 467 suggested bacon and 79 suggested tomatoes. The difference between the number of students who suggested mashed potatoes and those who suggested tomatoes is 144 - 79 = 65. The answer is 65.

instruction: After eating a hearty meal they went to see the Buckingham palace. There, Rachel learned that 703 visitors came to the Buckingham palace on the previous day. If there were 246 visitors on that day. How many visited the Buckingham palace within 25 days?
output: There were 703 visitors on the previous day and 246 visitors on that day. That means in total 703 + 246 = 949 visitors visited the Buckingham palace within 25 days. The answer is 949.

instruction: There are 8 different movies and 21 different books in the ' crazy silly school ' series. If you read 7 of the books and watched 4 of the movies. How many more movies do you still have to watch?
output: There are 8 movies and 21 books in the series. You have read 7 books and watched 4 movies. That means you still have 21 - 7 = 14 books to read and 8 - 4 = 4 movies to watch. The answer is 4.

instruction: After resting they decided to go for a swim. The depth of the water is 16 times Ron's height. Dean is 9 feet taller than Ron. If Ron stands at 13 feet. How deep was the water?
output: Ron stands at 13 feet. Dean is 9 feet taller, so Dean stands at 13 + 9 = 22 feet. The water is 16 times Ron's height, so it is 16 * 13 = 208 feet deep. The answer is 208 feet.

instruction: The Razorback t-shirt shop makes $ 87 dollars off each t-shirt sold. During the Arkansas game and the Texas tech game they sold a total of 95 t-shirts. If they sold 47 t-shirts during the Arkansas game. How much money did they make from selling the t-shirts?
output: They sold 47 t-shirts during the Arkansas game and 95 t-shirts in total. That means they sold 95 - 47 = 48 t-shirts during the Texas tech game. They make $87 from each t-shirt, so they made 48 * $87 = $4,096 from selling the t-shirts. The answer is $4,096.

instruction: Allan brought 5 balloons to the park. If Jake brought 6 more balloons than the number of balloons that Allan brought. How many balloons did Jake bring to the park?
output: Allan brought 5 balloons. Jake brought 6 more than that, so he must have brought 5 + 6 = 11 balloons. The answer is 11.

instruction: Debby bought 200 water bottles and 256 soda bottles when they were on sale. If she drank 312 water bottles and 4 soda bottles a day. How many days would the soda bottles last?
output: Debby bought 200 water bottles and 256 soda bottles. She drinks 312 water bottles and 4 soda bottles a day. That means she drinks 316 bottles a day. The total number of bottles she has is 200 + 256 = 456. The number of days the soda bottles will last is 456 / 316 = 1.44 days. The answer is 1.44 days.

instruction: Julia played tag with 5 kids on monday. She played tag with some more kids on tuesday. If she played with a total of 15 kids. How many kids did she play with on tuesday?
output: She played with 5 kids on Monday. She played with a total of 15 kids. That means she must have played with 15 - 5 = 10 kids on Tuesday. The answer is 10.

instruction: There are 16 different books and 14 different movies in the ' crazy silly school ' series. If you read 19 of the books and watched 13 of the movies. How many more books than movies are there in the ' crazy silly school ' series?
output: There are 16 books and 14 movies in the series. You read 19 books and watched 13 movies. That means you have read 19 - 13 = 6 more books than movies. The answer is 6.

instruction: There are 87 oranges and 290 bananas in Philip's collection. If the bananas are organized into 2 groups and oranges are organized into 93 groups. How big is each group of bananas?
output: There are 87 oranges and 290 bananas. The oranges are organized into 93 groups. That means the bananas must be organized into 2 groups. The total number of bananas is 290. So each group must have 290 / 2 = 145 bananas. The answer is 145.

instruction: Brenda's mother made cookies for 10 guests but 9 guests did not come. If she prepared 18 cookies and each guest had the same number of cookies. How many did each of them have?
output: There were 10 guests but 9 did not come. That means only 1 guest came. There were 18 cookies prepared. Each guest had the same number of cookies. So the 1 guest had 18 / 1 = 18 cookies. The answer is 18.

instruction: Summer is almost here and most animals are migrating back to cooler countries. There are 87 bird families living near a mountain. If 18 new bird families joined them. How many bird families live near the mountain now?
output: There were 87 bird families living near the mountain. 18 new bird families joined them. So in total there are 87 + 18 = 105 bird families. The answer is 105.

instruction: A mailman has to give 38 pieces of junk mail to each of the 78 blocks. If there are 19 houses on a block. How many pieces of junk mail should he give each house?
output: The mailman has to give 38 pieces of junk mail to each of the 78 blocks. That means he has to give 78 * 38 = 2964 pieces of junk mail in total. There are 19 houses on a block. So, each house should get 2964 / 19 = 156 pieces of junk mail. The answer is 156.

instruction: Brenda's mother made cookies for 14. If each of them had 30 cookies. How many cookies did she prepare?
output: She made cookies for 14 people. Each person had 30 cookies. That means in total she prepared 14 * 30 = 420 cookies. The answer is 420.

instruction: Bobby ate 23 pieces of candy. If he initially had 30 pieces of candy. How many pieces of candy does he still have left?
output: Bobby initially had 30 pieces of candy. He ate 23 pieces, so now he has 30 - 23 = 7 pieces of candy. The answer is 7.

instruction: There are some baskets of peaches. Each basket has 4 red peaches and 3 green peaches. If there are a total of 7 peaches in all baskets. How many baskets of peaches are there?
output: Each basket has 4 red peaches and 3 green peaches. That means each basket has 4 + 3 = 7 peaches. There are 7 peaches in total. So, there must be 7 / 7 = 1 basket. The answer is 1.

instruction: The Ferris wheel in paradise park has 18 seats. Each seat can hold 15 people. If 10 seats are broken. How many people can ride the Ferris wheel at the same time?
output: There are 18 seats in total. 10 of them are broken. That means there are 18 - 10 = 8 seats that are working. Each seat can hold 15 people. So, 8 * 15 = 120 people can ride the Ferris wheel at the same time. The answer is 120.

instruction: You had 26 bags with equal number of cookies. If you had 15 candies and 52 cookies in total. How many cookies does each bag have?
output: We know that there are 26 bags with equal number of cookies. We also know that there are 15 candies and 52 cookies in total. That means the total number of items is 15 + 52 = 67. Since there are 26 bags, each bag must have 67 / 26 = 2.57 items. Since each bag has only whole number of items, we can round it down to 2 items. So each bag has 2 cookies. The answer is 2.

instruction: Bobby had 32 pieces of candy. He ate some pieces of candy. If he has 20 pieces of candy left. How many pieces of candy did Bobby eat?
output: Bobby had 32 pieces of candy. He ate some pieces of candy. Now he has 20 pieces of candy left. The difference must be the number of pieces he ate. So, he must have eaten 32 - 20 = 12 pieces of candy. The answer is 12.

instruction: They decided to hold the party in their backyard. If they have 5 sets of tables and each set has 10 chairs. How many more chairs than tables do they have?
output: They have 5 sets of tables and each set has 10 chairs. That means they have 5 * 10 = 50 chairs. They have 5 tables. So they have 50 - 5 = 45 more chairs than tables. The answer is 45.

instruction: They decided to hold the party in their backyard. They have 2 sets of tables, each having the same number of chairs. If there are a total of 12 chairs in the backyard. How many chairs are there for each table?
output: There are 12 chairs in total. This means each table must have 12 / 2 = 6 chairs. The answer is 6.

instruction: The Razorback t-shirt shop makes $ 106 dollars off each t-shirt sold. During the Arkansas game and the Texas tech game they sold a total of 242 t-shirts. If they sold 115 t-shirts during the Arkansas game. How many t-shirts did they sell during the Texas tech game?
output: They sold a total of 242 t-shirts. 115 were sold during the Arkansas game. That means 242 - 115 = 127 t-shirts were sold during the Texas tech game. The answer is 127.

instruction: We ordered 17 pizzas. Each pizza has 4 slices. If there are 25 of us. How many slices of pizza are there altogether?
output: We ordered 17 pizzas. Each pizza has 4 slices. That means there are 17 * 4 = 68 slices of pizza. There are 25 of us. So in total there are 68 * 25 = 170 slices of pizza. The answer is 170.

instruction: There were some birds sitting on the fence. 4 more birds came to join them. If there are a total of 5 birds on the fence now. How many birds had been sitting on the fence at the start?
output: There are 5 birds on the fence now. 4 more birds came to join them. That means there were originally 5 - 4 = 1 bird on the fence. The answer is 1.

instruction: Because of the decision Sofia asked the students to suggest specific types of food. 457 students suggested adding mashed potatoes while others suggested adding bacon to the menu. If 63 more students suggested adding mashed potatoes than those that suggested bacon. How many students suggested bacon?
output: 457 students suggested adding mashed potatoes and 63 more suggested mashed potatoes than those that suggested bacon. That means there must have been 457 - 63 = 394 students that suggested bacon. The answer is 394.

instruction: Jack received 3 emails in the afternoon, 6 emails in the morning and some more in the evening. If he received a total of 10 emails in the day. How many emails did jack receive in the evening?
output: Jack received 3 emails in the afternoon and 6 emails in the morning. That means he has already received 3 + 6 = 9 emails. He received a total of 10 emails in the day. So he must have received 10 - 9 = 1 email in the evening. The answer is 1.

instruction: Josh lost 11 marbles. If he had 19 marbles in his collection earlier. How many marbles does he have now?
output: He had 19 marbles in his collection earlier. He lost 11 marbles, so now he has 19 - 11 = 8 marbles. The answer is 8.

instruction: Randy uses 36 blocks to build a tower. If he had 59 blocks. How many blocks are left?
output: Randy used 36 blocks to build the tower. He had 59 blocks in total. So the number of blocks left must be 59 - 36 = 23 blocks. The answer is 23.

instruction: Lewis earns a total of $ 1216 during the harvest. If he earns $ 16 each week. How many weeks did the harvest last?
output: Lewis earns $1216 in total. He earns $16 each week. That means he must have worked for 1216 / 16 = 76 weeks. The answer is 76.

instruction: Frank was reading through his favorite book. It took him 16 days to finish the book. If the book had 112 pages. How many pages did he read per day?
output: Frank read the book for 16 days. The book had 112 pages. So in total he read 112 pages. To find out how many pages he read per day, we divide 112 by 16. 112 / 16 = 7. The answer is 7 pages per day.

instruction: There are 896 skittles in Steven's skittles collection. Steven also has 517 erasers and 90 scales. If the skittles are organized into 8 groups. How big is each group?
output: Steven has 896 skittles, 517 erasers and 90 scales. We are only interested in the skittles. 896 skittles divided into 8 groups means each group has 896 / 8 = 112 skittles. The answer is 112.

instruction: Randy has some blocks. He uses 52 blocks to build a tower. If there are 38 blocks left. How many blocks did he have at the start?
output: He used 52 blocks to build the tower. That means he had 52 blocks at the start. After that, he has 38 blocks left. So the total number of blocks he had at the start must have been 52 + 38 = 90 blocks. The answer is 90.

instruction: Matthew had 22 crackers and 34 cakes. If Matthew gave equal numbers of crackers and cakes to his 11 friends. How many crackers did each person eat?
output: Matthew had 22 crackers and 34 cakes. He gave 11 friends equal numbers of crackers and cakes. That means he gave 11 * (22 + 34) = 11 * 56 = 616 crackers and cakes in total. Since he gave 11 friends, each person ate 616 / 11 = 56 crackers. The answer is 56.

instruction: 10 red peaches and some more green peaches are in the basket. If there are a total of 15 peaches in the basket. How many green peaches are in the basket?
output: There are 10 red peaches and some green peaches. In total there are 15 peaches. So the number of green peaches must be 15 - 10 = 5. The answer is 5.

instruction: Jack received 4 emails in the morning and some more in the afternoon. If he received a total of 5 emails in the day. How many emails did Jack receive in the afternoon?
output: Jack received 4 emails in the morning. In total he received 5 emails in the day. That means he must have received 5 - 4 = 1 email in the afternoon. The answer is 1.

instruction: At the zoo, a cage had 95 snakes and 61 alligators. If 64 snakes were hiding. How many snakes were not hiding?
output: There were 95 snakes and 61 alligators in the cage. 64 snakes were hiding. That means there were 95 - 64 = 31 snakes that were not hiding. The answer is 31.

instruction: Haley has 20 marbles. In her class 2 boys love to play marbles. If she distributes her marbles equally. How many will each of the boys receive?
output: She has 20 marbles. She wants to distribute them equally to 2 boys. That means each boy will get 20 / 2 = 10 marbles. The answer is 10.

instruction: Carol was sending out birthday invitations to 10 friends. If each package of invitations she bought had 2 invitations in it. How many packs does she need so that no friend gets left out?
output: She needs to send out 10 invitations. Each package has 2 invitations. So she needs 10 / 2 = 5 packages. The answer is 5.

instruction: The bananas in Philip's collection are organized into 196 groups. If there are a total of 392 bananas in Philip's banana collection. How big is each group?
output: There are 196 groups and 392 bananas in total. Each group must have 392 / 196 = 2 bananas. The answer is 2.

instruction: Ed had 12 more marbles than Doug. Ed lost 20 of his marbles at the playground. If Ed had 17 marbles. How many marbles does Doug have now?
output: Ed had 12 more marbles than Doug. That means Doug had 12 less marbles than Ed. Ed had 17 marbles, so Doug had 17 - 12 = 5 marbles. The answer is 5.

instruction: Because of the decision Sofia asked the students to suggest specific types of food from a total of 66 choices. If 450 students suggested adding mashed potatoes 38 suggested adding bacon to the menu and the rest did not participate. How many students participated in the suggestion of new food items?
output: There were 66 choices in total. 450 students suggested adding mashed potatoes and 38 suggested adding bacon. This means that 450 + 38 = 488 students participated in the suggestion of new food items. The answer is 488.
